channel.title: free range statistics
channel.description: I write about applications of data and analytical techniques like statistical modelling and simulation to real-world situations. I show how to access and use data, and provide examples of analytical products and the code that produced them.

item.title: Too important to leave to the data scientists
item.description: Data is good, data skills are better and a data skills plan is best.

item.title: Polls v results
item.description: The polls did worse than usual in predicting the Australian federal election, but the pundits were far worse than the polls.

item.title: House effects, herding, and the last few days before the election
item.description: A few small explorations of idiosyncracies with polls, a couple of days before the Australian federal election.

item.title: Familiarisation with the Australian Election Study
item.description: I familiarise myself with the 2016 Australian Election Study, a wonderful source of individual level data on attitudes and behaviour relating to voting.

item.title: Animating the US Treasury yield curve rates
item.description: I ponder the limitations of animation, and how much work is needed to turn a fun animation into a great story.

item.title: Using svglite with web fonts
item.description: svglite is a great way for producing good graphics for the web but there's a small hack needed if you want to use web fonts with it.

item.title: Website with Australian federal election forecasts
item.description: I've put up a page with my current Australian federal election forecasts for the House of Representatives, which I'll keep up to date until the election comes.

item.title: Better predictions for AFL from adjusted Elo ratings
item.description: I improve my AFL predictions by adjusting Elo ratings for home team advantage (varying by home team) and with a more data-driven approach to parameters for the actual ratings.

item.title: AFL teams Elo ratings and footy-tipping
item.description: I use Elo ratings from 12 months or from 120 years of AFL results to predict the results in the next round. Predictions based on just the past 12 months do better than those using the full history.

item.title: Exploring swings in Australian federal elections
item.description: I explore the data on two-party-preferred voting swings in Australian federal elections and tentatively introduce the ozfedelect R package.
